Operation 'get_/wayback/v1/available' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Both summary and description are empty, making it impossible for AI agents to understand the operation's purpose. Added clear action-oriented summary explaining the core function. Description now includes what the operation does (queries for archived snapshots), expected inputs (URL and optional filters), what it returns (availability results with metadata), and guidance on when to use it.

data.summary_suggestion: Check if URL snapshots are available in Wayback Machine
data.description_suggestion: Queries the Wayback Machine to determine if archived snapshots exist for a given URL. Accepts URL and optional filtering parameters (timestamp, status code, mimetype, output format, collapse, match type). Returns availability results indicating whether snapshots are available and metadata about matching snapshots. Use this operation to verify if a URL has been archived before attempting to retrieve specific snapshots.
data.reasoning: Both summary and description are empty, making it impossible for AI agents to understand the operation's purpose. Added clear action-oriented summary explaining the core function. Description now includes what the operation does (queries for archived snapshots), expected inputs (URL and optional filters), what it returns (availability results with metadata), and guidance on when to use it.

message: Operation 'post_/wayback/v1/available' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Both summary and description are empty. Added clear action-oriented summary distinguishing this batch operation from the GET endpoint. Description explains the batch nature of the operation, the request format (AvailabilityRequests array), response format (AvailabilityResults), and provides context for when an AI agent should use this POST variant instead of the GET endpoint.

data.summary_suggestion: Batch check URL snapshot availability in Wayback Machine
data.description_suggestion: Submits a batch of URLs to the Wayback Machine to check snapshot availability for multiple URLs in a single request. Accepts an AvailabilityRequests array containing URL and optional filtering parameters for each request. Returns AvailabilityResults containing availability status and snapshot metadata for each submitted URL. Use this operation when you need to check availability for multiple URLs simultaneously to reduce API calls.
data.reasoning: Both summary and description are empty. Added clear action-oriented summary distinguishing this batch operation from the GET endpoint.
